ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I could recommend this course to other students. While this course was not heavy for me, it brought essential informations for my future research. It might be efficient to learn about mice in our field by attending this course.

GENE 703 was a helpful course to learn about mouse experimental techniques, ethical issues relating to mouse experiments, and writing grant applications. I would recommend the course to a fellow student.

Excellent overview of mouse models, how they are constructed, their various uses, strengths, and weaknesses, and the intricacies and details that must be taken into account when constructing and performing experiments on them.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learn how to practically use CAS9/CRISPR technology. Also, I learned what should I concern when I develop my own mice for research.
In this course, I learned about different experimental techniques to use on mice and other rodents. The lectures involving metabolism experiments will aid me in my thesis research.

The course greatly enhanced my understanding of mouse models and the various considerations that must be taken into account when utilizing them. This knowledge will no doubt prove to be extremely useful in my research, which involves the use of mouse models.
